thread.title: Rangers' Beltre played with torn ligament in thumb
thread.title_full: Rangers' Beltre played with torn ligament in thumb

title: Rangers' Beltre played with torn ligament in thumb
text:
Rangers' Beltre played with torn ligament in thumb Rangers' Beltre played with torn ligament in thumb Post to Facebook Rangers' Beltre played with torn ligament in thumb Rangers' Beltre played with torn ligament in thumb   WFAA.com: http://on.wfaa.com/1LyBQ8r   Join the Conversation To   Rangers' Beltre played with torn ligament in thumb Mike Leslie, WFAA Sports 5:17 p.m. CDT October 16, 2015 Adrian Beltre is helped off the field in the third inning after an injury sustained against the Toronto Blue Jays in game one of the ALDS at Rogers Centre. (Photo: Nick Turchiaro-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Rangers' Adrian Beltre is tough as nails. He proved that this offseason, playing through a stiff back in Games 4 and 5 of the American League Divisional Series. 
But he'd been proving it all season, slightly under the radar. 
It was common belief that Beltre's thumb may not have been fully healthy when he returned from the disabled list in late June. 
But it turns out, Beltre was playing with a torn ligament in his thumb for the entire second half of the season. 
GM Jon Daniels says the injury didn't necessarily require surgery - "If it had, I think we would have considered going down that path." 
But celary, Beltre was playing through pain. 
"The prevailing opinion was 'rest'. But that's not really in his vocabulary. So, he played through what ideally he would've had more time to let cool off." 
In the 92 games that Beltre played after returning from his thumb injury, he batted .305, hit 12 home runs, batted in 65 runs, and was one of the key driving forces behind the Rangers run to an AL West championship. Read or Share this story: http://on.wfaa.com/1LyBQ8r TOP VIDEOS
